intro: Pilosella austrobavarica, commonly known as the mountain everlasting or alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, showy yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It has hairy leaves and a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to harsh mountain conditions. Pilosella austrobavarica is often found in meadows and open slopes at elevations above 1,500 meters.
